<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">his private vocabulary, he tried to harden & <del>ground</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">stiffen his poem with the ruder speech which <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gcha" key="Chaucer, Geoffrey">Chaucer</rs></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">used. For there was nothing, in the years that</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">came between the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-cant" key="Canterbury Tales, The">Canterbury Tales</rs> and the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-faer" key="Faerie Queene, The">Faery Queen</rs></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">for him to destroy; or to abolish.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>Then again</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He stands then, at the threshold of the great hall,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">– <quote source="#" rend="inline">"a little man with short hair, a small hand &</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">cuffs'</quote>– looking back at <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gcha" key="Chaucer, Geoffrey">Chaucer</rs>; & <del>He</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">This public is a reading aloud public of nobles;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& he has, <del>perhaps</del> <add place="above">the</add> disturbing [anticipation?]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of a language to whuch anything may happen.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">His desire to fasten to to the old English of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Chaucer arose perhaps from <del>his</del> a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">sense <del>that we cannot</del> sense long lost to us -–</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a sense of the future. <del>Suppose that he</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Why <del>look back to Chaucer, why graft his</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">what was going to happen to this new</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[attendantly?] growing speech which he must</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with his sensibility to words he must have</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">felt – everywhere – in talk, in songs –</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>it</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">And <del>so we reach the force wh.</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>The future</del> <del><del>This is a sense that only comes</del></del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The sense of the future is almost extinct, now.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But then, the writer must have been</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">aware, with the agitation of <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-espe" key="Spenser, Edmund">Spenser</rs></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that <del>something</del> it was all to come.</l>
